text: Kazimieras Uoka (4 March 1951 â€“ 16 July 2016) was a Lithuanian politician. He signed the 1990 Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania. He was born in Kaunas. Uoka graduated from Vilnius University in 1976. He was a leader of the labor movement in the early years of the independence movement. Uoka died on 16 July 2016 in Vilnius, aged 65. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Members of the Seimas
title: Kazimieras Uoka
